/acknowledgmentType.documentation: to specify the type of acknowledgment that is desired by the sender

/acknowledgmentType/cd.documentation: to specify the type of acknowledgment that is desired by the sender

/addressTypeBase/cd.documentation: to specify the type of address (home, work,...)

/addressTypeBase/district.documentation: District identification for the cities of Antwerpen-Anvers and Doornik-Tournai.

/authorType.documentation:
the author assumes the medical responsibility of the content of the transaction. It can be specified by a combination of hcparty elements (organisation, medical specialty, person), but it must necessarily contain one hcparty
        identifying one person. The author is not the transcriptionist that has typed the report. The author is not necessarily the performer of the act that is reported by the transaction. In that case, the author of the transaction can be overwritten at
        the level of the item

/authorType/hcparty.documentation:
the author assumes the medical responsibility of the content of the transaction. It can be specified by a combination of hcparty elements (organisation, medical specialty, person), but it must necessarily contain one hcparty
        identifying one person. The author is not the transcriptionist that has typed the report. The author is not necessarily the performer of the act that is reported by the transaction. In that case, the author of the transaction can be overwritten at
        the level of the item

/compoundType/quantityprefix.documentation:
to be used as a prefix for quantitiy (eg: ad 100
            ml)

/compoundprescriptionType.documentation:
a magistral preparation can be prescribed as a (coded)
        reference to a preparation in a reference book (formularyreference), or as a
        (coded) list of individual compounds (compoundlist), or as free text
        (magistraltext)

/compoundprescriptionType/galenicform.documentation:
Used to specify the galenic form. Can be a value
            from the reference table GALENIC_FORMS or free
            text

/compoundprescriptionType/quantity.documentation:
a magistral preparation can be prescribed as a (coded)
        reference to a preparation in a reference book (formularyreference), or as a
        (coded) list of individual compounds (compoundlist), or as free text
        (magistraltext)

/confidentialityType.documentation: to restrict the list of healthcare parties allowed to access to the content of the parent element

/confidentialityType/hcparty.documentation: to identify a healthcare professional, organisation or medical specialty.

/contentType.documentation: to specify the value of the item

/contentType/unit.documentation: to specify the value of the item

/contentType/minref.documentation: to specify the value of the item

/contentType/maxref.documentation: to specify the value of the item

/contentType/refscope.documentation: to specify the value of the item

/galenicformType/cd.documentation:
refers to a value of the reference table galenic
            forms

/folderType.documentation: contains the clinical information related to one patient

/folderType/confidentiality.documentation: contains the clinical information related to one patient

/folderType/id.documentation: this must be a sequential number within the parent element. In addition, it can specify alternative local identifier(s).

/folderType/patient.documentation: contains the clinical information related to one patient

/folderType/transaction.documentation: contains the clinical information related to one patient

/folderType/text.documentation: contains the clinical information related to one patient

/folderType/lnk.documentation: to link the folder with another element of the Belgian Healthcare Telematics System

/frequencyType.documentation: frequency of applying the periodic posology, only in case of a constant scheme during a period of time

/hcpartyType/id.documentation: ideally this should refer to a INAMI/RIZIV number. It can refer to alternative local identifiers.

/hcpartyType/cd.documentation: must at least refer to a value of CD-HCPARTY.

/headerType.documentation: to specify the routing of the message

/headerType/confidentiality.documentation: to specify the routing of the message

/headerType/standard.documentation: to specify the routing of the message

/headerType/id.documentation:
this must be a unique number within the Belgian Telematics Healthcare system . It should result of the concatenation of the first sender hcparty id of the current message, a dot and a unique identifier within the sending
            system. In addition, it can also specify alternative local numbers.

/headerType/sender.documentation: to specify the routing of the message

/headerType/recipient.documentation: to specify the routing of the message

/headerType/urgency.documentation: to specify the routing of the message

/headerType/acknowledgment.documentation: to specify the routing of the message

/headerType/text.documentation: to specify the routing of the message

/headerType/lnk.documentation: to link the header with another element of the Belgian Healthcare Telematics System

/headerType/expirationdate.documentation: expiration date of the message (used a.o. in prescription messages), can be used to remove a prescription form a prescription server

/headerType/externalsource.documentation: to specify the routing of the message

/headingType.documentation: a heading is used to organise the content of a transaction among chapters or paragraphs.

/headingType/confidentiality.documentation: a heading is used to organise the content of a transaction among chapters or paragraphs.

/headingType/id.documentation: this must be a sequential number within the parent transaction or parent heading. In addition, it can be alternative local identifier(s).

/headingType/cd.documentation: the heading must contain at least one code from the CDHEADING scheme. Local codes can be associated.

/incapacityreasonType.documentation: to specify the reason of an incapacity

/incapacityreasonType/cd.documentation: to specify the reason of an incapacity

/insuranceType/approvalnumber.documentation: Nr goedkeuring betalingsverbintenis van de VI

/itemType.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/confidentiality.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/id.documentation: this must be a sequential number within the transaction. In addition, it can specify alternative local identifier(s).

/itemType/cd.documentation: the item must contain at least one code from the CD-ITEM scheme. Local codes can be associated.

/itemType/content.documentation: this is used to specify the content of the item.

/itemType/author.documentation: this can be used to specify the medical responsible of the content of the item when it differs from the transaction 's author.

/itemType/beginmoment.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/endmoment.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/iscomplete.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/isvalidated.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/lifecycle.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/isrelevant.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/severity.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/certainty.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/temporality.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/urgency.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/quantity.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/strength.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/frequency.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/site.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/cost.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/dayperiod.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/duration.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/posology.documentation: quantity of product and frequence of administration per unit of period of time (day, week, hour, month etc...)

/itemType/regimen.documentation: ordered day regimen of administration applicable either on a precised day or on basis of the frequency

/itemType/regimen/quantity.documentation: number of pharmaceutical product units per intake / per administration (piece, puff, ml,...)

/itemType/deliverydate.documentation:
proposed date of delivery of that product in case of a prescription, delivery date in case of delivery of that product. Simple date type content based on a new basic datatype "date", similary, another new basic datatype "time"
            has been created

/itemType/renewal.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/route.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/batch.documentation: serial number of the product package

/itemType/instructionforpatient.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/instructionforreimbursement.documentation: to indicate the type of reimbursement based on medical justification for treatment

/itemType/instructionforpharmacist.documentation: to specify useful information for the pharmacist

/itemType/issubstitutionallowed.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/feedback.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/local.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/recorddatetime.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/itemType/lnk.documentation: the item is used to describe atomic medical information.

/kmehrmessageType.documentation: to transfer medical information about one or several patients (using one folder per patient).

/kmehrmessageType/confidentiality.documentation: to transfer medical information about one or several patients (using one folder per patient).

/kmehrmessageType/header.documentation: to transfer medical information about one or several patients (using one folder per patient).

/maxrefType.documentation: to specify the maximal range of the content

/medicationType.documentation: Deprecated at 01/01/2009, this complex type has been retained for backward compatibility only

/medicationType/tradename.documentation: Deprecated at 01/01/2009, this complex type has been retained for backward compatibility only

/medicationType/presentation.documentation: Deprecated at 01/01/2009, this complex type has been retained for backward compatibility only

/medicationType/strength.documentation: Deprecated at 01/01/2009, this complex type has been retained for backward compatibility only

/medicationType/route.documentation: Deprecated at 01/01/2009, this complex type has been retained for backward compatibility only

/medicationType/batch.documentation: serial number of the product package

/medicationType/instructionforpatient.documentation: Deprecated at 01/01/2009, this complex type has been retained for backward compatibility only

/medicationType/instructionforreimbursem.documentation: to indicate the type of reimbursement based on medical justification for treatment

/medicationType/issubstitutionallowed.documentation: to specify if the substitution by the pharmacist is allowed

/minrefType.documentation: to specify the minimal range of the content

/recipientType.documentation:
The recipient can be specified by a free combination of hcparty elements (organisation(s), medical specialty(ies), person(s)). If no individual person can be identified as recipient, you should specify a medical specialty or, at
        least the identification of the organisation that receives the message for further distribution (a regional server for example).

/recipientType/hcparty.documentation:
The recipient can be specified by a free combination of hcparty elements (organisation(s), medical specialty(ies), person(s)). If no individual person can be identified as recipient, you should specify a medical specialty or, at
        least the identification of the organisation that receives the message for further distribution (a regional server for example).

/recipientType/dummyFriend.documentation:
The recipient can be specified by a free combination of hcparty elements (organisation(s), medical specialty(ies), person(s)). If no individual person can be identified as recipient, you should specify a medical specialty or, at
        least the identification of the organisation that receives the message for further distribution (a regional server for example).

/refscopeType.documentation: to specify if the minref and maxref references are adjusted to the patient's age, sex, ...,

/refscopeType/cd.documentation: to specify if the minref and maxref references are adjusted to the patient's age, sex, ...,

/refscopeType/refvalue.documentation: to specify reference values for a given context

/senderType.documentation: the sender can be specified by a free combination of hcparty elements (organisation(s), medical specialty(ies), person(s)).

/senderType/hcparty.documentation: the sender can be specified by a free combination of hcparty elements (organisation(s), medical specialty(ies), person(s)).

/standardType.documentation: to specify the version of the kmehr specification to which this message complies

/standardType/cd.documentation: to specify the version of the kmehr specification to which this message complies

/standardType/specialisation.documentation: to specify the version of the kmehr specification to which this message complies

/telecomType/cd.documentation: the first cd specifies the type of address (home, work,...) and the second cd specifies the type of telecom device (phone, gsm, fax, ...)

/transactionType.documentation: a transaction is a set of medical information validated by one healthcare professional at one given moment.

/transactionType/confidentiality.documentation: a transaction is a set of medical information validated by one healthcare professional at one given moment.

/transactionType/id.documentation: this must be a sequential number within the folder. In addition, it can specify alternative local identifier(s).

/transactionType/cd.documentation: the transaction must contain at least one code from the CD-TRANSACTION scheme. Local codes can be associated.

/transactionType/date.documentation: usually this is the date of reporting. Please refer to detailed specification for particular cases.

/transactionType/time.documentation: usually this is the time of reporting. Please refer to detailed specification for particular cases.

/transactionType/author.documentation: the author endorses the medical responsibility of the content of the transaction. It must identify at least one physical person. In addition, it can also identify its medical specialty and/or organisation.

/transactionType/redactor.documentation:
the redactor identifies the context of transcription or generation of the content of the transaction. It can identifiy a physicial person like a secretary, nurse, ... and possibly its department and/or organisation. It can
            also represent a robot for automatic content generation, an application for example.

/transactionType/iscomplete.documentation: to specify if the transaction is partial or complete.

/transactionType/isvalidated.documentation: to specify if the content of the transaction has been medically validated.

/transactionType/expirationdate.documentation: expiration date of the prescription/transaction, can be used to remove a prescription from a prescription server

/transactionType/recorddatetime.documentation: a transaction is a set of medical information validated by one healthcare professional at one given moment.

/transactionType/version.documentation: a transaction is a set of medical information validated by one healthcare professional at one given moment.

/medicinalProductType.documentation:
a medicinal product can be identified
        unambiguously by a CNK code identifying
        a package. The descriptive
        identification is only mandatory in case
        of absence of a package ID.

/medicinalProductType/intendedcd.documentation:
in Belgium a selected CNK code
            out of the drug database

/medicinalProductType/deliveredcd.documentation:
in Belgium the effective
            delivered CNK code out of the
            drug database

/medicinalProductType/intendedname.documentation:
descriptive name in the package
            database, in Belgium the name
            use in the pharmacy database

/medicinalProductType/deliveredname.documentation:
a medicinal product can be identified
        unambiguously by a CNK code identifying
        a package. The descriptive
        identification is only mandatory in case
        of absence of a package ID.
